revised_title: Exploring the Whole-Cell Properties of Temperature-Sensitive Neurons in Rat Hypothalamic Slices
tldr: Researchers studied the properties of temperature-sensitive neurons in rat hypothalamic slices. They found that warm-responsive neurons depolarized and increased firing frequency when warmed, while cold-responsive neurons showed the opposite effect. The warm-activated current in warm-responsive neurons had a more positive reversal potential than in cold-responsive neurons, suggesting that differences in resting ionic conductances are responsible for the distinct behaviors of these neurons.
